text: Mamulichthys is an extinct bony fish from the Permian of what is now European Russia. Its only species is M. ignotus. It was small in size and resembled a coelacanth. Operculum is large and rounded. The ventral side had longitudinal rows of large and massive scales. == Related pages == * Ohmdenia * Orthocormus * Monotrematum == References == # Minikh (=Minich), Alla V. (2014). "Mamulichthys ignotus gen. et sp. nov., a new actinopterygian from the Middle Permian of the southeastern East Europe Platform". Paleontological Journal. Category:Extinct fish Category:Ray-finned fish
title: Mamulichthys
